summary:
During these unprecedented times we need genuine contact with others more than ever. To contribute as best I can, I would like to help you with your confidence speaking English. If you would like to practice your English speaking skills, please call me for your first complimentary conversation with me. Phone +31 6 517 99 590 or add me on WhatsApp. I look forward to hearing from you!

Living in the lovely city of Maastricht, looking to help others, I am an American with a EU citizenship (Dutch), capable of leading and motivating individuals & groups of people through creativity and genuine interest.

company.name: Gail Howard Public Relations & Conversations wit

profile_positions.company: Gail Howard Public Relations & Conversations wit
profile_positions.description: Over 30 years' experience teaching upper level businessmen and women conversational English for International companies in the local area include Sabic, DSM and Phillips. With specialization in English for sales, presentations, coaching and communication I still train upon request.
profile_positions.title: CEO

profile_positions.description:
Worked closely with the Executive Board and the Spokesperson/Director of Marketing & Communications to create many new projects as well as lead projects in need of innovation and development.

Implementation of:
- Social media- 20 Facebook groups, very innovative for any university at the time.
- Ambassadors Lecture Series at the request of current President, Mr. Martin Paul. Hosting former Presidents, Prime Ministers, Ambassadors and others.
- Mix&Mingle International Events for upwards of 1400 students, critical for student retention.
- Premium Project for Master students aimed at partnering with local business, worked as a personal coach for this project.
- International student recruitment, UK and Northern Ireland, a very successful project leading to top numbers of students coming from these countries as well as helping to put the UM on the map as one of the most promising young international universities. Innovative in our approach and rewarded with publicity beyond measure. UM is still benefitting from this progressive campaign. Through this intensive publicity campaign UM continues to be top choice of university, on the continent, for study outside of the UK.
profile_positions.title: Project Development

profile_positions.description: As a 5-month project my function was to liaise between the front and back of the house, Public Affairs.  I was wholely responsible for the hospitality of each visitor and the smooth unfolding of every event.  Front of the house included the ticket desk team, security and The Friends of the Museum.  I held meetings, did trainings and acted as a liason between these departments.  Back of the house included the development of a sales program for the better expoitation of the museum – rental of the spaces the museum has available, organization of exhibition openings etc.  I have organized courses for the students of the University Maastricht (Meet & Greet for PIM card holders), the Museum Open Day with over 2000 guests and set up the basis for the Tefaf After Party with then partner, The Rijksmuseum before leaving my post.  We had a seperate PR department with whom I also worked closely.
profile_positions.title: Event Coordinator

profile_positions.description: 2 Flexible days per week I was responsible for researching the need for an International Business Community in the Limburg area.  Interviews followed up by a comprehensive report advised the Province on the steps required to make the Limburg area a great place to live and do International business.  Mr. Herman Vrehen, Regional Minister of Economy and Innovation at the time earmarked 100,000 euros per 2 year period for this project.  50,000 additional funds were also promised, a total of 300,000 euros were fundraised.
profile_positions.title: Public Relations Research

profile_positions.description:
This was an exciting short-term project for MSM - bringing Mr. C.K. Prahalad (author of the renowned business book “The Bottom of the Pyramid”) to the school with all that it entails.  My responsibilities included generating press and marketing for this event as well as the organization of the day itself. In only a few short weeks I was able to create a national publicity campaign.  I arranged press coverage leading up to the event as well as a press breakfast where Het Financieele Dagblad interviewed and filmed Mr. Prahalad and Mr. Siebesma (CEO of DSM International).  Over 25 newspapers and radio media persons were present on this day including ANP, NRC, Volkskrant, Elsevier, Telegraph, Financieele Dagblad, Business News Radio the local Limburgs Dagblad and many others.  

This media event was the most successful in their fifty-year history.  We received over 13 articles in various papers including two in the Financieel Dagblad (one front page with photo) and a ¾ page article with large color photo in the NRC. Many reporters said they had never seen anything like this press conference before.  A full account of all newspaper articles is available.
profile_positions.title: Public Relations Campaign

profile_positions.description:
This was a one-year project where I was the fund raiser/profiler for this museum. My work contributed to over Euro 50.000 in donations and subsidies. I organized and hosted many high-end parties for politicians, celebrities, artists and major donors. My responsibilities included organization of music, decor, flowers and caterers, light, sound etc. I held press parties and private viewings, planned special events and implemented new gift giving ideas. Through perseverance I found new donors, secured major gifts and grants for the museum on a political level as well as with major companies. I was responsible for developing a network within the city, the Province, and the International environment. My fund raising laid the groundwork for the museum’s expansion project with the city and province. 

2007 Events Procured and Organized for the Spanish House Museum (In alphabetical order);
- Artesia Bank
- AZM Board and guests
- Dinner party for Mayor Leers & important guests
- Dinner party for Governor Frissen & important guests  
- DSM International – Retirement party for  Mr. Alverdinck
- International Womens Club (Hats and High Tea Year End Party, see Aug-Sept ‘07 Chapeau Limbourgeois)
- LIOF - Board
- Lion’s Club Nijmegen
- Noortman Master Paintings, Presentation of the new book,  ‘100 Master Paintings’
- Piper Heidsieck Champagne                           
- Provincie Limburg -  250 guests for the  Zilver Conventie Limburg Mr. Martin Eurlings 
- Rabobank
- Struyskommitee 3 days Preuvenement received more than 300 guests and sponsors from many companies including: Xerox, Mosa, ING Bank, NWG Newspaper Group, Pricewaterhouse Cooper)
- TEFAF lunch French Press delegation from Paris 
- Vesteda – Board members 
- VVV Maastricht
profile_positions.title: Business Development

profile_positions.description: Mulholland designs and manufactures high-end lighting systems for art collectors and museums. As a consultant I was responsible for generating new sales with the world’s leading Art Galleries. My activities resulted in the succesful aquisition of the first very three Galleries at TEFAF in 2006. I also initiated and achieved free publicity in leading Art Magazines and newspapers (including most noteworthy, The Financial Dagblad) at the time of the opening of TEFAF.
profile_positions.title: Sales And Marketing Specialist
